Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a form of government censorship that infringes on free speech and civil rights.
Historical documents and events are cited to argue against censorship, emphasizing the importance of free expression.
The bill is perceived as a step towards authoritarianism and could lead to government-sanctioned propaganda.
The submission references past instances, such as the pandemic, where government actions were seen as censorship.
The author believes that individuals have the right to access all information and make their own judgments without government interference.
Main Themes: Mistrust in government handling of information
Notable Quotes: Censorship in any form seeks to control forms of communication and provides a dangerous opportunity for permissible government sanctioned propaganda.
This Bill is the introduction of a very authoritarian intrusive step into communism.

People are born with free will and therefore have the ability to access education which allows them to foster the deduction and discernment skills and critical thinking skills required to make the best informed consenting decisions.
